question: If rₚ, vₚ, Lₚ and rₐ, vₐ, Lₐ are radii, velocities and angular momenta of a planet at perihelion and aphelion of its elliptical orbit around the Sun respectively, then
choices: rₚ > rₐ, vₚ > vₐ, Lₚ > Lₐ
rₚ < rₐ, vₚ > vₐ, Lₐ = Lₚ
rₚ > rₐ, vₚ < vₐ, Lₐ = Lₚ
rₚ < rₐ, vₚ < vₐ, Lₐ < Lₚ
explanation: Angular momentum is conserved, so Lₚ = Lₐ.
Perihelion is the closest point, so rₚ < rₐ.
From conservation of angular momentum (mvr = constant), since rₚ < rₐ, vₚ must be > vₐ.
